intro: Echinomastus johnsonii, commonly known as Johnson's echinomastus, is a rare and unique succulent native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing stems and leaves. The plant produces striking, spiny flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
